organization.fullName: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective Natural History Study of Carotid Atherosclerosis

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

leadSponsor.name: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A prospective study of 700 patients with coronary artery disease will undergo non invasive evaluation of their carotid arteries by ultrasound and microwave radiometry. The patients will be followed up for 3 years and their outcome regarding the cardiovascular events (death, cardiac events, cerebrovascular events) will be recorded
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Carotid artery Thermal heterogeneity recorded by MR will be corelated to cardiovascular events (death, cardiac events, cerebrovascular events) as well as to all demographic (age, sex, hypertension, dyslipidemia, smoking status, etc) factors

armGroups.label: carotid thermal heterogeneity
armGroups.description: Patients that have carotid thermal heterogeneity detected by MR

armGroups.label: no carotid thermal heterogeneity
armGroups.description: Patients that DONT have carotid thermal heterogeneity detected by MR

armGroups.label: carotid artery disease
armGroups.description: Patients with detected carotid artery disease by ultrasound

armGroups.label: no carotid artery disease
armGroups.description: Patients with no carotid artery disease detected by ultrasound

primaryOutcomes.measure: To detect if carotid ultrasound and carotid microwave radiometry measurements can predict the incidence of cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events in patients with coronary artery disease
primaryOutcomes.description: Microwave radiometry is a non invasive and safe technique that measures temperature of the internal tissues by detecting the normal radiation of the tissues in microwave frequencies. The primary outcome of the study is to see if the temperatures measured in the carotid arteries of patients with coronary artery disease can predict their outcome regarding cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Relation of other demographic factors with carotid ultrasound and microwave radiometry measurements and outcome

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Consecutive patients with coronary artery disease admitted in our hospital

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with history of previous cerebrovascular event,
* History of vasculitis, intermittent inflammatory, infectious, or neoplastic conditions likely to be associated with an acute-phase response.

overallOfficials.name: Konstantinos Toutouzas
overallOfficials.affiliation: First department of Cardiology, University of Athens Greece

locations.facility: First Department of Cardiology, University of Athens, Medical School. Hippocratio Hospital
